Module contents

class connection.MongoConnection(mongodb_db: str = 'pwnboard', mongodb_host: str = '127.0.0.1', mongodb_port: int = 27017)

Bases: object

This class manages provides a layer of abstraction between the database and the web application. This calss provides functions to create and query database resources.

Parameters

  • mongodb_db (str, optional) – The collection mongodb should use, defaults to pwnboard

  • mongodb_host (str, optional) – The host mongodb is running on, defaults to 127.0.0.1

  • mongodb_port (str, optional) – The port mongodb is listening on, defaults to 27017

BuildBoard(board: list) → List[models.host.Host]

Takes in a list of dictionaries defining the board. Modeled after the paragon board. Example board:

[
    {
        "name": "Hulto - web-server",
        "primaryIP": "10.0.0.1",
        "os": "LINUX",
        "serviceGroup": "web-server",
        "teamName": "Hulto",
        "tags": ["Linux", "Web", "HTTP"]
    },
    {
        "name": "Hulto  - mail-server",
        "primaryIP": "10.0.0.2",
        "os": "LINUX",
        "serviceGroup": "mail-server",
        "teamName": "Hulto",
        "tags": ["Linux", "mail"]
    },
]
Parameters

board (List[Host]) – A list of JSON dictionaries The primaryIP, serviceGroup, and teamName fields are required others can be used as the need arises.

Returns

The board we just built as a List of Host objects, An empty [] will be returned on error or an exception will be raisedd

Return type

List[Host]

CreateToolDescription(tool_name: str, poc: str, usage: str) → None

Create a tool description object and save it to the DB. Tool Descriptions help users better identify and use tools when working with pwnboard.

Parameters

  • tool_name – The name of your tool.

  • poc (str) – The point of contact for the tool used for questions, and trouble shooting.

  • usage (str) – Basic usage instructions to describe what your tool does and how to use it.

GetActiveToolHosts(tool_names: List[str], timeout_seconds: int) → List[models.host.Host]

Filter for hosts that have a tool installed and have seen it within timeout_seconds.

Parameters

  • tool_names – A list of tool names. If a callback has been seen and is within timeout_seconds seconds that host will be returned. [“goofkit”,”reptile”]

  • timeout_seconds (int) – The number of seconds before a tool is counted as timed out.

Returns

A list of hosts belonging to the requested tools and within the request timeout, returns [] on error or none foundd.

Return type

List[Host]

GetBoard() → List[models.host.Host]

Returns the current board. Pulls all hosts form the database. This may eventually become cachedd in redis if performance is an issue.

Returns

The whole board as a List of Host objects, An empty [] will be returned on error or an exception will be raisedd

Return type

List[Host]

GetHost(primary_ip: str) → models.host.Host

Return Host object matched by primary_ip (the primary key for Host).

Parameters

primary_ip (str) – The primary_ip used by the Host.

Returns

The Host object requested.

Return type

Host

GetInstalledToolHosts(tool_names: List[str]) → List[models.host.Host]

Filter for hosts that have had a tool installed.

Parameters

tool_names – A list of tool names. If any have called back to pwnboard from a host that host will be returned. [“goofkit”,”reptile”]

Returns

A list of hosts belonging to the requested tools, returns [] on error or none foundd.

Return type

List[Host]

GetNeverActiveToolHosts(tool_names: List[str]) → List[models.host.Host]

Filter for hosts that have never had a tool installed.

Parameters

tool_names – A list of tool names. If a callback has never been seen from one of those tool/host combinations that host will be returned. [“goofkit”,”reptile”]

Returns

A list of hosts belonging to the requested tools, returns [] on error or none foundd.

Return type

List[Host]

GetServiceHosts(service_group: List[str]) → List[models.host.Host]

Filter for hosts from specific service groups.

Parameters

service_group – A list of service groups to pull hosts from. [“web-server”,”ssh-server”]

Returns

A list of hosts belonging to the requested service groups, returns [] on error or none found.

Return type

List[Host]

GetTeamHosts(team_name: List[str]) → List[models.host.Host]

Filter for hosts from specific teams.

Parameters

team_name (List[str]) – A list of team names to pull hosts from. [“Hulto”,”squidli”]

Returns

A list of hosts belonging to the requested teams, returns [] on error or none foundd.

Return type

List[Host]

GetTimedOutToolHosts(tool_names: List[str], timeout_seconds: int) → List[models.host.Host]

Filter for hosts that have a tool installed but haven’t see it in timeout_seconds.

Parameters

  • tool_names – A list of tool names. If a callback has been seen before but not within the last tool_names seconds that host will be returned. [“goofkit”,”reptile”]

  • timeout_seconds (int) – The number of seconds before a tool is counted as timed out.

Returns

A list of hosts belonging to the requested tools and outside the request timeout, returns [] on error or none foundd.

Return type

List[Host]

GetToolDescription(tool_names: List[str]) → List[models.tool.ToolDescription]

Get the description objects of multiple tools given a list of tool names.

Parameters

tool_names – A list of tool names. To pull the Tool Description for.

Returns

A list of ToolDescriptio objects based on the names provided, returns [] on error or none foundd.

Return type

List[ToolDescription]

RegisterCallback(primary_ip: str, tool_name: str) → int

Registers a callback for a tool against an IP.

Parameters

  • primary_ip (str) – The primary IP used by the host.

  • tool_name (str) – The name of the being recorded.

Returns

The total number of beacons recived for that tool/ip combination.

Return type

int

WipeCollection()

Delete the Host and ToolDescription collections. Mostly used for testing should not be used mid event.

conn = None
createHost(primary_ip: str, name: str, fqdn: str, os: str, team_name: str, service_group: str, tags: List[str]) → models.host.Host

Create a new Host object and save it to the database.

Parameters

  • primary_ip (str) – The primary_ip used by the Host.

  • name (str) – A common name used to describe the host.

  • fqdn (str) – The fully qualified domain name used by the host.

  • os (str) – The os the host is running.

  • team_name (str) – The team the host belongs to.

  • service_group – The service_group the host belongs to.

  • tags (List[str]) – Additional tags to identify the host.

Returns

The Host object created.

Return type

Host

createHostDict(hostdict: dict) → models.host.Host

Create a new Host object. Derived from a dictionary or loaded JSON.

{
    "name": "Hulto - web-server",
    "primaryIP": "10.0.0.1",
    "os": "LINUX",
    "serviceGroup": "web-server",
    "teamName": "Hulto",
    "tags": ["Linux", "Web", "HTTP"]
}
Parameters

hostdict (dict) – The structure defining the Host.

Returns

The Host object createdd.

Return type

Host

createTool(tool_name: str) → models.tool.Tool

Creates a new Tool object given the name.

Parameters

tool_name (str) – The name of the being recorded.

Returns

The Tool object created.

Return type

Tool
